packageJSON.name: bravify
packageJSON.description: Creates a random Ultimate Bravery build for a champion in League of Legends, adding it to the proper folder for it to be loaded in game.

releases.name: Bravify v1.2.3
releases.body:
The 'Learning to Count' update!

This release is just a bugfix that stops the app from trying to "update" to an older version.

releases.name: Bravify v1.2.2
releases.body: This update just brings in some Google Analytics code, so I can see how people are using the app, and catch any errors that might occur out in the wild.

releases.name: Bravify v1.2.1
releases.body: Just a quick fix for the champ select window not being properly centered when it opens.

releases.name: Bravify v1.2.0
releases.body:
The Autoupdate Update!

Bravify now contains the ability to automatically update itself. When you start Bravify, it will check this GitHub repository for a more recent update than the version you're running, and if it finds one, it will download the update and restart itself, so that it's using the latest and greatest.

I've also made some small changes to how windows are opened, so hopefully those people who have dual- or tri- monitor setups will have a little better experience when opening the app.

releases.name: Bravify v1.1.0
releases.body:
Bravify now supports Linux! There are also some small bugfixes in this version, as well as some interface changes.

The "Save build" button has been replaced with a dropdown menu that allows you to save the current build, delete the current saved build, or change the path that Bravify uses for League of Legends.

I've also made it so that you can click on the name of the background image skin (at the bottom right of the window), and it will open the splash art in your web browser, in case you want to take a closer look at it. Note: This functionality is a bit spotty on Linux.

Downloads are below. Use Bravify-darwin-x64.zip if you're on a Mac, Bravify-linux-x64.zip or Bravify-linux-ia32.zip if you're on Linux, or one of the win32 files if you're on Windows.

releases.name: Bravify v1.0.2
releases.body:
This release brings with it just a few changes. I've fixed a bug where the app doesn't always close when you close the main window, and I've made a change to how the titlebar is rendered. 

Additionally, I've done some work for better caching of data on the server side of things, so the app should load faster than before, as well.

Downloads are below. Use Bravify-darwin-x64.zip if you're on a Mac, and use one of the win32 files if you're on Windows.

releases.name: Bravify v1.0.1
releases.body:
Bravify now caches data locally, only updating when Riot changes their version number.

Downloads are below. Use Bravify-darwin-x64.zip if you're on a Mac, and use one of the win32 files if you're on Windows.

releases.name: Bravify v1.0.0
releases.body:
This is the first release of Bravify. If you have any questions about the app, see README.md. If you're questions aren't answered there, feel free to create an issue. Same if you happen to come across any bugs (I'm sure there are a few I didn't find during my testing).

Downloads are below. Use Bravify-darwin-x64.zip if you're on a Mac, and use one of the win32 files if you're on Windows.
